keyTakeAways: A Colombian appeals court overturned the conviction of former President Alvaro Uribe on fraud and bribery charges, citing structural deficiencies in the original ruling.
Uribe was the first former Colombian president to be convicted of a crime, making this case historically significant.
The ruling has intensified political divisions, with critics accusing the judiciary of covering up right-wing paramilitary abuses and human rights violations.
Senator Ivan Cepeda has announced plans to appeal the decision to the Supreme Court of Justice, indicating that the case is far from concluded.

The outcome has drawn international attention, particularly from US President Donald Trump and Secretary of State Marco Rubio, who have criticized the judicial process in Colombia as biased against conservative leaders.
The case is expected to influence Colombia’s 2026 presidential election, with Uribe’s party and Cepeda both signaling political ambitions.

Former President Gustavo Petro has criticized the decision, linking it to the normalization of paramilitary ties in Colombian politics and accusing the US of attempting to influence the outcome through alliances with Uribe supporters.
The case underscores ongoing tensions between Colombia’s judiciary, political parties, and international actors over accountability and political bias.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A Colombian appeals court has overturned the conviction of former President Alvaro Uribe on fraud and bribery charges, citing structural flaws in the original ruling. This marks the first time a former Colombian president has been convicted of a crime. Uribe, who served from 2002 to 2010, was accused of conspiring with paramilitary members to manipulate witness testimony, a claim he denied. The decision has intensified political polarization, with critics like President Gustavo Petro accusing the judiciary of covering up paramilitary abuses. Senator Ivan Cepeda has announced plans to appeal the ruling to the Supreme Court. The case has drawn international attention, particularly from U.S. officials, including Donald Trump and Marco Rubio, who have criticized Colombia’s judicial system as biased. The outcome has significant implications for Colombia’s 2026 presidential election, where political dynamics may shift based on the evolving legal status of Uribe and the potential for broader political realignments.
title: Colombian appeals court strikes down ex-President Uribe’s conviction
